results.title: Gas, food lodging
results.creator_credit: Allison Anders, Daniel Hassid, Seth Willenson, William Ewart and Cineville
results.brief_description: Set in Laramie, New Mexico, this film deals with the relationship between a single mother and her two teenage daughters, complicated by small town isolation. The film explores the notion of family as it tackles issues of love, death, sex and escape. Stars Brooke Adams, Ione Skye and Fairuza Balk in the lead roles. Cast also includes James Brolin, Robert Knepper, David Landsbury, Chris Mulkey and Donovan Leitch. Screenplay by Alison Anders, based on the novel ‘Don’t Look and It Won’t Hurt’ by Richard Peck. Edited by Tracy S. Granger. Photographed by Dean Lent. Music composed by J. Mascis.

results.title: A Small town idol
results.creator_credit: Erle C Kenton, Mack Sennett and Mack Sennett Comedies
results.brief_description: Slapstick comedy about small town resident, Sam Smith (Ben Turpin) who has been framed for stealing by the scoundrel J. Wellington Jones as a ploy to stop him from wooing Mary (Phyllis Haver), the prettiest single girl in town. Cast also includes Charlie Murray, Marie Prevost, Billy Bevan.

results.title: Wrong world
results.creator_credit: Ian Pringle, Bryce Menzies and Seon Film Productions
results.brief_description: After rejecting the conventional career path of a successful practice, an idealistic young doctor recalls, 8 years later, time spent in Bolivia, drug addiction and a trip across America. During a course of rehabilitation in Melbourne he meets a young woman, an addict and petty thief. The recollection of this indeterminate journey suggests the disconnected process of memory. The title suggests how the different worlds in which the doctor has travelled in search of meaning have only increased his sense of dislocation. Photographed by Ray Argall. Cast includes Richard Moir and Jo Kennedy.

results.title: Addio tradizione
results.creator_credit: Anna Louise Sortini, Open Window Productions and South Australian Film Corporation
results.brief_description: Childhood memories are recalled whilst Sylvanna (Marcella Russo), a housewife, ponders her adolescent years with migrant Italian parents in Australia. A series of moving images show the Italian customs experienced throughout her childhood and the growing tensions and difficulties in the family as she reaches puberty and the two cultures of differing family values clash.

results.title: The Silence of the lambs (Special edition)
results.creator_credit: Jonathan Demme, Edward Saxon, Kenneth Utt, Ron Bozman, Orion Pictures Corporation and Strongheart Films
results.brief_description: Based on the best-selling novel by Thomas Harris, “Silence of the Lambs” is a disturbing and chilling thriller. The film - which won five Academy Awards, is highlighted by the superb performances of Jodie Foster as FBI cadet Clarice Starling and Anthony Hopkins as the psychotic criminal ,once brilliant psychiatrist, Dr. Hannibal “the Cannibal” Lecter. Starling’s job is to tap Lector’s mind in order to find the serial killer known as “Buffalo Bill”, a killer who skins his victims. Lector uses his macabre knowledge to entice Clarice into intricate but chilling mindgames. The film’s focal point is not so much the catching of the killer, but the relationship between Starling and Lector. The audience is manipulated so that Lecter is simultaneously repellent and charismatic, thus contributing to the tension and unease of the film.

results.title: Dark wind
results.creator_credit: Errol Morris, Patrick Markey and Northfork Motion Pictures
results.brief_description: Dark Wind is a tangled web of deceit between two law enforcements. Lou Diamond Phillips plays Jim Chee a young police officer working on a reserve in Arizona belonging to the Navajo’s. He finds himself in constant dispute with the local sheriff of the Hopi clan who want to share the reserve with the Navajo’s. Into the web is a robbery, a plane crash and a decaying body that has been in the desert for some time and the mysterious call in the wind of death. Nothing is as it seems in this electric thriller set amongst ritual and superstition of the people of Arizona. Cast also includes Fred Ward, Gary Farmer, John Karlen.

results.title: Brass
results.creator_credit: Sidney A. Franklin, Harry Rapf and Warner Bros Pictures
results.brief_description: Philip Baldwin (Monte Blue) is the son of a prosperous fruit-farmer. His marriage to Rosemary, daughter of his father’s best friend has been planned since they were children, but when gold-digging city girl Marjorie (Marie Prevost) finds work during the summer vacation at the ranch, she seduces Philip into marriage. Domestic problems, city living and friction with his mother-in-law contribute to Marjorie divorcing Philip and abandoning their son. Philip then discovers true love with Mrs Grotenberg (Irene Rich) the widow who boards with the family and cares for the child. Cast also includes Harry Meyers, Frank Keenan and Harvey Clark. Based on the novel by Charles G. Norris.

results.title: Virgin machine = Die Jungfrauen Maschine
results.creator_credit: Monika Treut, 11 Film and Hyena Films
results.brief_description: Initially intending to write a story, Dorothy, a young journalist researching romantic love, travels to the United States following the footsteps of her mother who immigrated there many years before. In San Francisco she is introduced to the lesbian scene by a number of women including Susie Sexpert who initiates her into the practical arsenal of the American pragmatics of love, Dominique, a Hungarian bohemian from Uruguay and Ramona, a lesbian sex therapist with whom she falls in love. Treut employs experimental techniques to facilitate a first person insight into Dorothy’s journey of sexual discovery. The direction and camera style also reflect the film’s two locales; Germany, where Dorothy experiences paranoia, and California, the wonderland where she reacts with amazement at the subcultures she discovers. Cast includes Ina Blum, Shelly Mars, Peter Kern and Susie Bright.

results.title: Asterix conquers America
results.creator_credit: Gerhard Hahn, Jurgen Wohlrabe and Extrafilm Production
results.brief_description: When a brawl breaks out between the Gauls and the Romans, the potion that gives Asterix and Obelix their powers tips over. Before more can be made, the Romans kidnap Getafix and hurl him into space, believing of course that the world is flat. When Asterix and Obelix go after him, they land in America, encountering strange animals and meeting a group of Indians. Based on the popular books by Goscinny and Underzo.

results.title: For the term of his natural life
results.creator_credit: Rob Stewart, Patricia Payne, Filmco and Paynes Schiller Productions
results.brief_description: Colin Friels plays Rufus Dawes in Marcus Clarke’s epic novel. Forced to leave his England home after being disinherited by the man he believed to be his natural father, Rufus is dealt another cruel blow when, on learning his father’s real identity, is falsely arrested for his murder and sentenced to transportation to Van Dieman’s Land for the term of his natural life. Once there, Rufus experiences many hardships and cruel acts, mainly at the hands of other hardened convicts but also from Lieutenant Frere, the feared and brutal ruler of the prison colonies. One thing that helps Rufus through this time is Sylvia, the daughter of Major Vickers with whom he holds a special but long forgotten bond. It is Rufus’ courage and will to survive that maintains him through many escape attempts and the desire for freedom that make him an extrodinary person - barely living on the land that is pure hell.
